info.papyri.dispatch.browse.facet

Class Facet

  • java.lang.Object
    • info.papyri.dispatch.browse.facet.Facet
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BooleanFacet, DateFacet, HasImagesFacet, IdentifierFacet, LanguageFacet, NomeFacet, PlaceFacet, StringSearchFacet, TranslationFacet

    public abstract class Facet
extends Object
    Handles all the necessary backend (Solr) and frontend (HTML) interactions needed for selection of constraint values within a single facet.
    Author:
    thill

      • generateWidget

        public String generateWidget()
        Generates the HTML form element used for input.
        Returns:
        A string representation of the requisite HTML

      • getAsQueryString

        public String getAsQueryString()
        Returns the Facet's constraints as a query string. Required for pagination links to maintain state across pages.
        Returns:
        A querystring representing a Facets constraints.
        See Also:
        FacetBrowser#doPagination(java.util.ArrayList, long), FacetBrowser#buildFullQueryString(java.util.ArrayList)

      • getAsFilteredQueryString

        public String getAsFilteredQueryString(String filterParam,
                                       String filterValue)
        Returns the Facet's constraints as a query string, minus the value passed to the method, Required for the anchor links that (from the user's perspective) 'remove' constraints from the faceted display.
        Returns:
        A querystring representing the Facet's constraints, excluding the value passed as a String.
        See Also:
        FacetBrowser#assemblePreviousValuesHTML(java.util.ArrayList, java.lang.StringBuilder, java.util.Map)

      • addConstraints

        public Boolean addConstraints(Map<String,String[]> params)
        Parses the parameters submitted in the HttpServletRequest and stores those relevant to the Facet in question
        Parameters:
        params -
        Returns:
        A Boolean indicating whether or not a constraint exists on the current Facet.

      • getFormNames

        public String[] getFormNames()
        Returns the value(s) to be used for the name attribute on HTML form controls. In most cases only one value is required, and will be tat of the formName member. However, some facets have more than one HTML control - hence the need for this method to return an array of Strings, rather than a String.
        Returns:

      • getCSSSelectorID

        public String getCSSSelectorID()
        Returns the formName member in lower case, to be used as an id value for the HTML form control
        Returns:

      • getDisplayValue

        public String getDisplayValue(String value)
        Takes a raw facet value and formats it appropriately for display in the facet's HTML form control. Under most circumstances, the passed value itself will be appropriate for display; some subclasses, however, may need to override this method to cope with particular values requiring special treatment.
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:
